definitions.definition: A habitual patron , regular purchaser , returning client ; a person or company who has a custom of buying from a particular business.
A patron , a client ; a person or company who purchases or receives a product or service from a business or merchant , or intends to do so.
examples: Every person who passes by is a potential customer .
Airlines are the chief customers of the commercial divisions of large-aircraft manufacturers such as Airbus, Boeing, and Embraer.

definitions.definition: A person, especially one engaging in some sort of interaction with others.
A native official who exacted customs duties .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) A habitual patron , regular purchaser , returning client ; a person or company who has a custom of buying from a particular business.
secondary_definitions: A patron , a client ; a person or company who purchases or receives a product or service from a business or merchant , or intends to do so.
( informal ) A person, especially one engaging in some sort of interaction with others.
( India , historical ) A native official who exacted customs duties .
